docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN my daughter, Reine, requested that I join her husband to witness the birth of their first child, I was shocked, flattered and somewhat terrified. But the prospect was too awe-inspiring to turn away from. So when Reine called from Brooklyn, with contractions nine minutes apart, I started packing. This was the girl, now woman, to whom I had given birth 28 years ago, she who had been a perfect baby, an endearing child, a fractious teenager, a complicated and creative adult. Now she was about to be a mother, and I was miles away, in Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y.

headline.main: In Need of a Saint With the Right Credentials

docs.abstract: Christine Lehner Generations essay on searching for patron saint of childbirth as her daughter prepared to give birth; drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: STRIEGEL--Jana. Dancer and published Holiday House author, passed away December 17th, 2006 at 51, after a 12 year battle with breast cancer. Diagnosed while pregnant, her successful pregnancy inspired her article for The New York Times. Jana leaves behind her husband Mark and adored son Tanner.

docs.lead_paragraph: A genetic database that helps match children adopted from war zones with their biological families is helping children who were adopted during El Salvador’s civil war.

headline.main: Separated by War, Reunited Through DNA
headline.print_headline: Separated by War, Reunited Through DNA

docs.lead_paragraph: Governor-elect Eliot Spitzer yesterday made several high-level appointments in his administration, including the selection of an in-house lobbyist for Cablevision as his secretary of state.

headline.main: Spitzer Secretary of State Is Company Lobbyist
headline.print_headline: Spitzer Secretary of State Is Company Lobbyist

docs.snippet: Governor-elect Eliot Spitzer yesterday made several high-level appointments in his administration, including the selection of an in-house lobbyist for Cablevision as his secretary of state.

byline.original: By JONATHAN P. HICKS and CASSI FELDMAN

docs.lead_paragraph: Governor-elect Eliot Spitzer yesterday made several high-level appointments in his administration, including the selection of an in-house lobbyist for Cablevision as his secretary of state. The lobbyist, Lorraine A. Cortés-Vázquez, is a former president of the Hispanic Federation and also served as chief of staff to former Assemblyman Roberto Ramirez, a Spitzer ally who headed the Bronx Democratic Party organization. She is currently vice president of government and public affairs for the Cablevision Systems Corporation.

headline.main: Spitzer Secretary of State Is Company Lobbyist

docs.abstract: New York State Gov-Elect Eliot Spitzer appoints Lorraine A Cortes-Vazquez as secretary of state; she is currently lobbyist for Cablevision Systems Corp; appointment makes Cortes-Vazquez highest-ranking Hispanic official in Spitzer administration; other appointments and nominations made by Spitzer in assembling new state government noted (M)
